Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2018 05:17PM raisan_angels wrote: Hi Emma, I was just diagnosised too. Try to keep your head up and think postive as much as you can. The waiting is really hard. Not knowing what is coming and knowing the cancer is in you still is scary. I’ll be thinking of you and praying for you in this difficult time. We will get through this one step at a time.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with invasive ductal breast cancer Emma1973 raisan_angels

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2018 06:09PM raisan_angels wrote: @Jenmia2002 - San Antonio Medical Center - it’s for military families. It’s frustrating because it’s hard to get regular results usually. I don’t know how to compare wait times with a military hospital to civilian. I’m concerned that they felt the need to biopsy the lymph node immediately. I have very large dense breasts and I’m afraid that this could have been going on a long time without me knowing. @beach2beach - Thank you. Since I’m confident they were probably not working on the weekend. Then maybe these results will come tomorrow. I just have never had a test take this long to get back. I’ve had a lot of nonCancer related surgeries over the years.
Posts.Title: 31 years old - BRAIDS5 raisan_angels Jenmia2002

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2018 09:48AM raisan_angels wrote: Thank you all for your support. I got my results. I am joining the club no one wants to join. I have breast cancer and it’s also in my lymph node.
Posts.Title: 31 years old - BRAIDS5 raisan_angels Jenmia2002

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2018 04:38PM raisan_angels wrote: @Marie I do not live in the northeast. There’s only been beautiful weather here in Texas. Unfortunately, I can’t attribute the delay to weather. Maybe the holidays. But even then the hospital is open through the holidays. I’m not panicking. I’ve accepted that I have BC. My breast is hard like a rock and it has a 2cm lump you can feel. It happened very suddenly. I also was distressed from the reaction of the radiologist and techs. I just want some answers so I can have a double mastectomy and get the camera out of my body before it spreads further. I’m very concerned about the lymph node involvement
Posts.Title: 31 years old - BRAIDS5 raisan_angels Jenmia2002

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2018 04:48PM raisan_angels wrote: @Jenmia2002 I actually don’t think I am very far from you. I live right outside of San Antonio in Cibolo. I go to SAMC for care. My husband is Air Force. We only moved here recently.
Posts.Title: 31 years old - BRAIDS5 raisan_angels Jenmia2002

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2018 01:56PM raisan_angels wrote: I can't thank you enough for your replies. I've spent the last couple of months very sick off and on with nausea and dirreah so I'm fearing the worst. Especially, becuae of the inflamed lymph node. It makes me terrified and Im having a much more difficult time handling this than Ithought I would since it's very fast and very sudden.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy results and scared. raisan_angels raisan_angels
